ANU.name: Mahesh Brahmadesham Venkataraman
interest: I have a background in Materials Science with expertise in high temperature thermo-chemical and thermo-mechanical processes. My research interests include solar driven thermo-chemical processes, energy storage, high temperature oxidation and molten salt corrosion. My current research focusses on utilization of solar and other renewable energy resources for power generation, production of synthetic fuels, zero-carbon steelmaking and hydrogen production.Please note that I am currently based in Adelaide, SA and working full-time for 1414 Degrees Ltd., Adelaide, South Australia.
ANU.biography: 2004 - 2008: B. Tech in Materials and Metallurgical Engineering, IIT Kanpur, India.

Microsoft-Academic.title: nanocrystalline and bimodal fe cr alloys synthesis mechanical properties and oxidation resistance
